meanings.definition: A locking device that secures something in an upward position.
meanings.sent1: The uplock on the gate kept it closed securely.
meanings.sent2: She installed the uplock on the window to keep it open.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to open the uplock on the bird feeder but failed comically.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like an uplock, keeping his joy hidden from the world.
meanings.sent5: The uplock clicked into place, ensuring the door stayed shut.

meanings.definition: To fasten or secure something in an upward position.
meanings.sent1: He needed to uplock the ladder before climbing up.
meanings.sent2: Please uplock the shelf to prevent it from falling.
meanings.sent3: The magician uplocked the flower pot in mid-air, astonishing the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her determination uplocked her focus on the goal, ignoring all distractions.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic uplocked the engine in place to avoid any movement during repair.
